h1_38: Albert Einstein Healthcare Network/Einstein Medical Center Montgomery Program
span_48: Albert Einstein Healthcare Network/Einstein Medical Center Montgomery Program
p_63: Dashes ("-") indicate data for a particular field are not provided for this program in Residency Explorer. Reasons why data are not being provided can vary (e.g., they are not reported or available, they are not applicable, or they are based on an insufficient number of people for reporting purposes).
h3_67: # of Filled Resident Positions, by Year*
p_78: *Totals may vary from year to year due to off-cycle residents.
th_96: # of Residents Who Were Graduates of a Joint MD-PhD program
p_99: The Einstein Healthcare Network includes urban and suburban hospitals, as well as level 1 trauma and transplant centers. It is the largest independent academic medical center in the region with a long-standing commitment to outstanding medical education, quality patient care and research. Einstein Montgomery residents read studies across the network via a common PACS. Residents at all sites are taught and supported by the faculty and resources across the entire Einstein Network.

p_349: The race/ethnicity data are shown alone or in combination with other race/ethnicity responses. Because some individuals may report multiple races/ethnicities, the totals may not equal 100%. Only residents who are U.S. citizens or permanent residents are included in race/ethnicity counts.
